questions.question: According to Vladimir Arnold, proofs are to mathematics what _________ is to poetry.
questions.hint: Compare the artistic structure of characters in a poem to the structure of a mathematical work.
questions.explanation: The text quotes Vladimir Arnold: "Proofs are to Mathematics what calligraphy is to poetry".

questions.question: A proof of a mathematical statement consists of a sequence of statements where each is justified by:
options: A definition, axiom, or previously established proposition
questions.hint: Think about the chain of deductive arguments.
questions.explanation: A proof consists of a sequence of statements, each justified with a definition, an axiom, or a proposition that is previously established.

questions.question: In a direct proof, how does the process begin?
options: By assuming the conclusion is false
By splitting the statement into multiple cases
By starting directly with what is given in the proposition
By finding an example where the statement fails
questions.hint: The name "Direct Proof" implies a straightforward approach.
questions.explanation: In a Direct Proof, we directly start the proof with what is given in the proposition.

questions.question: In Example 1, to prove "if x²−5x+6=0, then x=3 or x=2", which algebraic method is initially used?
questions.hint: The equation is transformed into (x−3)(x−2)=0.
questions.explanation: The text states the first step is proved by factorization: x²−5x+6=(x−3)(x−2).

questions.question: When proving the function f(x)=2x+5 is one-one using a direct method, what is the starting assumption?
questions.hint: The definition of a one-one function dictates the starting premise.
questions.explanation: The proof begins with the given that f(x₁)=f(x₂) and deduces that x₁=x₂.

questions.question: Mathematical Induction depends on an axiom related to a subset S of natural numbers N. Which condition must be met first?
options: The natural number k is in S
The natural number k+1 is in S
The natural number 1 is in S
questions.hint: Induction requires a base case or starting point.
questions.explanation: The axiom states that the natural number 1 must belong to the set S.

questions.question: In the principle of mathematical induction, if a statement S(n) is true for n=k, we must prove it is true for:
questions.hint: The inductive step moves from one integer to the immediate next.
questions.explanation: The principle states that if S(n) is true for n=k, then S(n) must be true for n=k+1.

questions.question: In Example 3 involving matrices, to prove P(k+1), the term A^(k+1) is written as:
questions.hint: Think about the laws of exponents applied to matrix multiplication.
questions.explanation: The solution states that A^(k+1) = A^k ⋅ A.

questions.question: Proof by cases is a valid method to prove p⇒q only when:
options: p can be split into cases r, s, t such that p = r ∨ s ∨ t
q can be split into cases r, s, t such that q = r ∨ s ∨ t
The number of cases is infinite
It is impossible to use deductive reasoning
questions.hint: The hypothesis must be exhaustive.
questions.explanation: This method is possible only when p can be split into several exhaustive cases.

questions.question: In Example 4, to prove the projection formula a = bcosC + ccosB, the triangle ABC is split into which three cases?
options: Acute angled, Obtuse angled, Right angled
Positive area, Negative area, Zero area
questions.hint: The classification depends on the angle C.
questions.explanation: The text splits the proof into cases where angle C is acute, obtuse, or a right angle.

questions.question: संसर्गजन्य रोग (Infectious Diseases) प्रामुख्याने कोणत्या घटकांमुळे होतात?
options: दूषित हवा, पाणी, अन्न किंवा वाहक
questions.hint: हे रोग बाह्य माध्यमांमार्फत पसरतात.
questions.explanation: संसर्गजन्य रोग हे दूषित हवा, पाणी, अन्न किंवा वाहक (कीटक व प्राणी) यांसारख्या बाह्य माध्यमांमार्फत पसरतात.

questions.question: खालीलपैकी कोणते वैशिष्ट्य असंसर्गजन्य रोगांचे (Non-infectious Diseases) आहे?
options: हे रोग थेट संपर्कातून एका व्यक्तीकडून दुसऱ्या व्यक्तीकडे पसरत नाहीत.
questions.hint: हे रोग संक्रामक नसतात.
questions.explanation: असंसर्गजन्य रोग संसर्गातून किंवा थेट संपर्कातून एका व्यक्तीकडून दुसऱ्या व्यक्तीकडे पसरत नाहीत आणि ते सूक्ष्मजीवांमुळे होत नाहीत.

questions.question: संसर्गजन्य रोगांवर मुख्य उपचार पद्धती कोणती असते?
questions.hint: यामध्ये रोगकारकांना नष्ट करणे अपेक्षित असते.
questions.explanation: संसर्गजन्य रोगांवर प्रतिजैविके, लस आणि विषाणू-विरोधी औषधे वापरून रोगकारकांना नष्ट करणे हा मुख्य उपचार असतो.

questions.question: खालीलपैकी कोणता रोग 'असंसर्गजन्य' गटात मोडतो?
questions.hint: हा रोग जीवनशैली किंवा चयापचयाशी संबंधित आहे.
questions.explanation: मधुमेह हा असंसर्गजन्य रोग आहे, तर क्षय, इन्फ्लुएन्झा आणि डेंग्यू हे संसर्गजन्य आहेत.

questions.question: संसर्गजन्य रोगांचा कालावधी व तीव्रता सामान्यतः कशी असते?
options: तीव्र (Acute) आणि कमी काळात बरे होणारे
questions.hint: हे रोग अचानक उद्भवतात.
questions.explanation: संसर्गजन्य रोग अनेकदा तीव्र (Acute) स्वरूपाचे असतात आणि औषधोपचाराने कमी काळात बरे होऊ शकतात.
